title: Google\Cloud\Dialogflow\V2\Document
name: Document
description:
A knowledge document to be used by a [KnowledgeBase][google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.KnowledgeBase].

For more information, see the knowledge base guide. Note: The projects.agent.knowledgeBases.documents resource is deprecated; only use projects.knowledgeBases.documents.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.Document

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Optional. The document resource name. The name must be empty when creating a document. Format: projects/<Project ID>/locations/<Location ID>/knowledgeBases/<Knowledge Base ID>/documents/<Document ID>.

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: Required. The display name of the document. The name must be 1024 bytes or less; otherwise, the creation request fails.

params.name: data.mime_type
params.description: Required. The MIME type of this document.

params.name: data.knowledge_types
params.description: Required. The knowledge type of document content.

params.name: data.content_uri
params.description: The URI where the file content is located. For documents stored in Google Cloud Storage, these URIs must have the form gs://<bucket-name>/<object-name>. NOTE: External URLs must correspond to public webpages, i.e., they must be indexed by Google Search. In particular, URLs for showing documents in Google Cloud Storage (i.e. the URL in your browser) are not supported. Instead use the gs:// format URI described above.

params.name: data.raw_content
params.description: The raw content of the document. This field is only permitted for EXTRACTIVE_QA and FAQ knowledge types.

params.name: data.enable_auto_reload
params.description: Optional. If true, we try to automatically reload the document every day (at a time picked by the system). If false or unspecified, we don't try to automatically reload the document. Currently you can only enable automatic reload for documents sourced from a public url, see source field for the source types. Reload status can be tracked in latest_reload_status. If a reload fails, we will keep the document unchanged. If a reload fails with internal errors, the system will try to reload the document on the next day. If a reload fails with non-retriable errors (e.g. PERMISION_DENIED), the system will not try to reload the document anymore. You need to manually reload the document successfully by calling ReloadDocument and clear the errors.

params.name: data.latest_reload_status
params.description: Output only. The time and status of the latest reload. This reload may have been triggered automatically or manually and may not have succeeded.

params.name: data.metadata
params.description: Optional. Metadata for the document. The metadata supports arbitrary key-value pairs. Suggested use cases include storing a document's title, an external URL distinct from the document's content_uri, etc. The max size of a key or a value of the metadata is 1024 bytes.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The current state of the document.

methods.name: getEnableAutoReload
methods.description:
Optional. If true, we try to automatically reload the document every day (at a time picked by the system). If false or unspecified, we don't try to automatically reload the document.

Currently you can only enable automatic reload for documents sourced from a public url, see source field for the source types. Reload status can be tracked in latest_reload_status. If a reload fails, we will keep the document unchanged. If a reload fails with internal errors, the system will try to reload the document on the next day. If a reload fails with non-retriable errors (e.g. PERMISION_DENIED), the system will not try to reload the document anymore. You need to manually reload the document successfully by calling ReloadDocument and clear the errors.

Generated from protobuf field bool enable_auto_reload = 11 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];
